Description: Half of a very small scarab broken along its longitudinal axis along the perforation. Made of a vivid turquoise faience. Prothorax and Elytra are divided by a single line, the humeral callosities are shown in a triangle and the head is just about visible. The legs are not shown and the base has no markings.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
